alert.note: Alert for Chilton; Coosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 11 at 8:17PM CDT until August 11 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN CHILTON...SOUTHEASTERN SHELBY AND NORTHWESTERN COOSA COUNTIES... At 817 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Calera, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Calera, Columbiana, Jemison, Wilsonville, Thorsby, Marble Valley, Lay Lake, Shelby, Minooka Park, Beeswax Creek Park, Alabama 4H Center, Shelby Shores, Waxahatchee Creek, Highway 145 and CR 46, Paint Creek, Kelley Branch and Spring Creek. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
